Description: Fragment of a seal-impression made of fine brown Nile clay that was hardened after excavation and shows darker discolouration as well as a partly glossy surface. The rear is slightly convex with impressions of textile like from a bag or a vessel. In the break the impression of a turned cord with a width of 0.3 cm. The front side is concave and is covered in finger impressions. It shows a part of a scarab-like seal impression with a scarab with elaborate wings that are subdivided by lines.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.7 temple magazine
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
